DOC.brief_summary: Prospective , nonrandomized , single-center , single-arm feasibility safety study assess feasibility safety endovascular stent-graft implantation use standard configuration branch fenestrated stent graft ( TAAA device ) physician-specified branch fenestrated stent graft ( Physician-Specified TAAA Devices ) treatment thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm ( TAAA ) involve mesenteric renal artery patient high risk open surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Feasibility Safety Endovascular Thoracoabdominal Aortic Aneurysm Repair Using Standard-Configuration Stent Graft With Branches Fenestrations Patients High Risk Open Surgical Repair
DOC.criteria: 1 . Presence TAAA : 1 . Men TAAA great equal 6 cm diameter 2 . Women TAAA great equal 5 cm diameter 3 . Men TAAA large 5 cm diameter enlarge rate 10mm/year 4 . Women TAAA large 4.5 cm diameter enlarge rate 10mm/year 5 . Men woman TAAA iliac artery aneurysm great equal 4cm diameter . 2 . Life expectancy 2 year . 3 . Ability give informed consent willing comply followup schedule . 4 . Suitable arterial anatomy endovascular TAAA repair `` TAAA device '' : ) Proximal aortic land zone : ) ≥ 20mm long ii ) ≤ 40mm ≥ 20mm diameter parallel aorta iii ) free circumferential thrombus iv ) ≤ 60 degree angulation b ) Mesenteric/renal aortic diameter ≥ 20mm c ) Mesenteric artery : ) ≥ 10mm long segment healthy artery branch attachment ii ) Diameter ≥ 4mm ≤ 12mm iii ) Absence aberrant early branching , aneurysm dissection ) Renal artery : ) ≥ 10mm long segment healthy artery branch attachment ii ) Diameter ≥ 4mm ≤ 8mm iii ) Absence aberrant early branching , aneurysm dissection e ) Iliac artery access : ) ≥ 6mm diameter , absence severe calcification tortuosity ii ) Or , plan creation surgical conduit TAAA device delivery f. For patient associated common iliac artery aneurysm ( > 20mm diameter ) , adequate internal external iliac artery landing zone common iliac artery luminal diameter ( iliac branch device use ) : . ≥ 10mm long segment healthy internal iliac artery branch attachment ii . Internal iliac diameter ≥ 5mm ≤ 12mm iii . External iliac diameter ≥ 6mm diameter , absence severe calcification tortuosity iv . Minimum common iliac artery luminal diameter ≥ 14mm v. Or , patient bilateral common iliac artery aneurysm without suitable anatomy , plan surgical bypass maintain patency least one internal iliac artery 5 . Patients deem high risk open repair ( meet one , , follow criterion ) : ) Age ≥ 65 year b ) Cardiac disease ) CAD ( history MI angina positive stress test revascularizable ) ii ) LV Ejection fraction < 40 % iii ) Symptomatic CHF ( NYHC Class II , III , IV ) c ) Pulmonary disease ) Home oxygen therapy ii ) FEV1 < 1.2 l/s iii ) Vital capacity < 50 % predict iv ) PaCO2 > 45 mm Hg < 60 mm Hg ) Renal disease ) ESRD dialysis ii ) eGFR < 60 e ) Prior aortic surgery f ) Hostile abdomen g ) Portal hypertension ( ascites varix ) h ) Coagulopathy 1 . Free rupture aneurysm . 2 . Pregnancy breastfeed . 3 . Unwillingness inability comply follow schedule . 4 . Serious systemic groin infection . 5 . Uncorrectable coagulopathy . 6 . Age < 18 year . 7 . Mycotic rupture aneurysm . 8 . Known degenerative connective tissue disease , e.g. , Marfan EhlerDanlos Syndrome . 9 . Known sensitivity allergy stainless steel , nitinol , polyester , solder ( tin , silver ) , polypropylene , urethane gold . 10 . Participation another another investigational device drug study within 1 year treatment . 11 . Unrelated concomitant major surgical interventional procedure ( ) within 30 day treatment date ( exception stag procedure plan part treatment ) ) Body habitus would inhibit Xray visualization aorta .
